overview:
Danny Rosen is a budding technologist with a passion for finance, music and business.

In 2004 Danny started work at Stony Brook University on his bachelors in Business Management. He was hired as a multimedia developer at TLT Media Lab, an on-campus multimedia development lab that specialized in experimental projects aiding university staff. He developed several applications and departmental websites while maintaining the lab’s linux music server. Throughout his time spent in university Danny interned at both MTV and Advanced Acoustic Concepts. Danny graduated in 2007 and joined Bloomberg L.P. as a member of their client-side technical support group. Danny helped build and manage the firm’s widely used internal documentation management system “Bwiki” while managing the Citigroup technical account. In 2010 Danny joined the Bloomberg Software Quality Assurance and Distribution group. In 2011 Danny left Bloomberg to work as a Software Quality Engineer at Buddy Media. During 2011 Danny and Robert Lancer (ArachnoDB) built Tubebook (http://www.Tubebook.org) which connects Facebook interests with Youtube videos. In 2012 Danny joined Sailthru as QA Engineer.
